questions.question_text: With the Marks card drop-down menu set to Automatic, a line chart will be created whenever you place what on the Rows shelf and the Columns shelf?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
When using relationships tableau aggregates data first and joins later

Selected Answer: C
From Tableau Help:
 During analysis, Tableau adjusts join types intelligently and preserves the native level of detail in your data. You can see aggregations at the level of detail of the fields in your viz rather than having to think about the underlying joins.
The answer : C

Selected Answer: C
C. The data sets include similar data aggregated at different levels of detail.

Answer is C
"You can see aggregations at the level of detail of the fields in your viz rather than having to think about the underlying joins."
https://help.tableau.com/current/online/en-us/datasource_relationships_learnmorepage.htm

Selected Answer: C
Relationship combine multiple tables, not multiple sheets
I thought the answer is A
C IS THE ANSWER

choices.C: The data sets include similar data aggregated at different levels of detail.
choices.D: The data sets include similar data aggregated up to the highest level.
choices.B: The data sets are in two separate tables within a single spreadsheet.
choices.A: To use both data sets across multiple sheets in a visualization.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BC
Remember: discrete blue & continuous green

Selected Answer: BC
discrete always blue, and continues always green

Selected Answer: BC
Anwser: BC
Always discrete values are in blue (doesnt matter if it is a Dimension or measure)
B and C

Selected Answer: BC
Blue versus green fields
Tableau represents data differently in the view depending on whether the field is discrete or continuous). Continuous and discrete are mathematical terms.

Continuous means "forming an unbroken whole, without interruption". These fields are colored green. When a continuous field is put on the Rows or Columns shelf, an axis is created in the view.
Discrete means "individually separate and distinct." These fields are colored blue. When a discrete field is put on the Rows or Columns shelf, a header is created in the view.

BC
-> The color shows whether it's discrete or continuous, and the location shows whether it's a measure or a dimension.

Selected Answer: BC
Blue is used for all DISCRETE fields, both dimensions and measures

Selected Answer: BC
